metadata.dc:author: Lobete Prieto, Carlos Javier
Fernández Toral, Joaquín
Madero Barrajón, Pilar
Llano Rivas, Isabel
metadata.dc:description: The characteristic phenotype of CHARGE syndrome includes: coloboma, congenital heart defect, choanal atresia, retarded growth and development, genital abnormalities, ear anomalies with or without hearing loss, which give the name (an acronym) to this condition. The molecular cause in 60% of the cases are mutations in the chromodomain helicase DNAbinding protein gene (CHD7), with an estimated frequency of 1 in 10,000 live born infants. We describe 3, not related patients with a clinical diagnosis of CHARGE syndrome and each of them with a different mutation in the CHD7 gene sequence.
metadata.dc:title: El síndrome CHARGE.
[CHARGE syndrome].
